Our work at NVIDIA is dedicated towards a computing model focused on visual and AI computing. For two decades, NVIDIA has pioneered visual computing, the art and science of computer graphics, with our invention of the GPU. The GPU has also shown to be spectacularly effective at solving some of the most complex problems in computer science.We are looking for a Product Marketing MBA Intern - Data Processing who is passionate about AI and data science to join NVIDIA’s product marketing group. The team is focused on helping developers and organizations use NVIDIA’s AI software stack to GPU-accelerate data analytics, machine learning, databases systems, and data processing engines as part of AI applications. We need people who are inspired by the rapidly accelerating pace of AI and want to help the data processing community to help build the future of artificial intelligence.What you’ll be doing:Develop marketing plans, conduct market research, author core content for launches in collaboration with engineering, product and solution architect teams.Partner with various marketing teams including PR and campaigns to promote this content across diverse channels to maximize reach and impact.Engage with the public to evangelize the use of NVIDIA AI tools to the developer community.What we need to see:Experience presenting deeply technical content to technical audiencesExcellent written and verbal communication skillsPassionate about getting things done quicklyAbility to work independently with directional feedbackPlease provide writing samples of public facing technical contentHands-on experience with data science tools such as pandas, Polars, scikit-learn, Google BigQuery, Amazon Redshift, SnowflakePythonFamiliarity with techniques used in ETL, modeling, AI and graph databasesCurrently pursuing an MBA degree (December 2026 to July 2027 graduation date) with a previous Bachelors in technical field such as engineering or STEMWays to stand out from the crowd:Published workflow samples and technical articles showing how to process data at scaleDirect experience developing with NVIDIA SDKsNVIDIA is widely considered to be one of the technology world’s most desirable employers. We have some of the most forward-thinking and hardworking people in the world working for us. If you are creative and autonomous, we want to hear from you!Our internship hourly rates are a standard pay based on the position, your location, year in school, degree, and experience. The hourly rate for our interns is 27 USD - 82 USD.
You will also be eligible for Intern benefits. ​Applications for this job will be accepted at least until December 12, 2025.

NVIDIA is committed to fostering a diverse work environment and proud to be an equal opportunity employer. As we highly value diversity in our current and future employees, we do not discriminate (including in our hiring and promotion practices) on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status or any other characteristic protected by law.
requirements: Currently pursuing an MBA degree (December 2026 to July 2027 graduation date) with a previous Bachelors in technical field such as engineering or STEM
responsibilities: Develop marketing plans, conduct market research, author core content for launches in collaboration with engineering, product and solution architect teams.
Engage with the public to evangelize the use of NVIDIA AI tools to the developer community.
Direct experience developing with NVIDIA SDKs
